resources.string: Whenever we read a physical book, the frequency with which we google words for their definitions is a massive loss of time and is extremely inefficient. It also results in the readerâ€™s attention to waver.

It is pretty easy!!. You just have to take a picture of the book page, and keep tapping on the words you want to find the meaning of. We use Firebase in the background to extract text, and Oxford API to find the meaning of the word.

Okay, this one is a really cool feature we are currently working on! You can plot the AR Model of the word in your environment in real-time. We have a limited number of supported words right now, so the feature won\'t work for all the words you are trying to search for.
Interested in what goes behind the screen??

This app is written purely in kotlin. We used jetpack libraries such as Retrofit, CameraX, DataBinding, etc. We used MVVM architectural pattern for the separation of the development of the graphical user interface.
For the design part, We used Material design 3 components. The font family is apercu. And the app design is highly inspired from HeadSpace Android app
We are using Firebase ML Kit for text extraction, Oxford API to find the meaning of the word, ARCore to plot the AR models, Wikipedia API
Other libraries include Coil, OkHttp, Picasso, Guava, etc
